abstract.p: Police Benevolent Assn begins arbitration with White Plains, NY, on new police contract (S)

block.p: The union representing White Plains police officers has begun arbitration with the city on a contract to replace one that expired last June. The Police Benevolent Association is seeking 7 percent raises. Richard K. Zuckerman, the city's outside labor lawyer, said the union rejected the city's offer of a 3 percent raise last year and a 3.2 percent in 2000. But James Carrier, the P.B.A. president, said the talks never got that far. The average White Plains officer is paid $55,233 a year, after four years. He said more than 60 officers have gone to higher-paying departments since 1986.
